column4: waaaitaminute.  Running dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg doesn't change /etc/X11/xorg.conf...  Hm.
have you changed that file yourself?
yes
did you read the directions at the top of xorg.conf?
try 'dpkg-reconfigure locales' and make sure that en_CA.UTF-8 is actually generated
network interfaces in promiscuous mode can often be detected remotely
yes, but I'm mildly suprised that they actually do that.
anything other than IRC :-) ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com would be reasonable
I'm surprised it's not in universe/multiverse though?
they do so :)
all architectures have all components
ghc6 built successfully on amd64
warty/universe didn't have ghc6, though
the fact that Ubuntu has a timeline for future releases should make that "you know" notice much cooler.
question is a technical term here; the question type would indeed by "note
it's in universe for both warty and hoary
Thanks.
think of it as a matrix: main == supported/free, restricted == supported/non-free, universe == unsupported/free, multiverse == unsupported/non-free
Thanks for the clarification about restricted.
http://morgue.ubuntu.com/
mm, we'd rather it weren't widely advertised as such because it would reduce the incentive for us to fix things :)
